intro: Brunellia comocladiifolia subsp. cundinamarcensis, commonly known as the Cundinamarca brunellia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Andes region of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
